meanings.definition: Dirt or soot that has accumulated on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The old car's windows were covered in grime.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children's hands were full of grime.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue hidden under the layer of grime on the window.
meanings.sent4: The city's history was buried under the grime of modernization.
meanings.sent5: The grime on the mirror made it impossible to see a clear reflection.

meanings.definition: A genre of electronic dance music characterized by dark, gritty beats.
meanings.sent1: The club played grime music all night long.
meanings.sent2: Fans of grime enjoy its unique sound and rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The grime music at the party got everyone on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The grime beats echoed through the underground music scene.
meanings.sent5: The DJ mixed different grime tracks seamlessly.

meanings.definition: To cover or become covered with dirt or soot.
meanings.sent1: The children managed to grime up their clothes while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: If you touch the walls with dirty hands, you will grime them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to grime itself in mud.
meanings.sent4: The old book's pages were grimed with age and use.
meanings.sent5: The fireplace grimes the ceiling with soot over time.
